answers.answer: Thats crazy!! Why are you having a csection? You think he wouldnt want your body to go into full blown labor if you have a planned csection....and if your in labor, wouldnt he want you at the hospital to see if they need to be prepping for a csection....doctor sounds odd

Wow. Usually they say if they are 5 mins apart and last for a minute then to go in. I wouldn't listen to the quack and if they get worse and longer go to l&d. At least they would check you. Water or not.

Wow that's crazy!!! U can b in active labor and your water not break..my water has never broke with all 4 of my births..I would be dialted to 6 or 7 and the doc would have to break it...if your contractions get close together 5 minutes apart for over an hour go to hospital especially if you are having a c section

I told my mother the same thing and that he need to be fired , my firstpregnancy i only went to 32 weeks bc i had preeclampsia so i don't know how to feel i never made it to 37-2 well 37-3 now im trying to wait until its a female dr in the office but i might end up going tonight

question: So i called the oncall dr bc im having contractions that are ten minutes apart along with alot of pressure and its hurts to move everytime i have a contraction, the oncall dr is the dr who was at the office who changed my csection date and didnt even checked to see if i dialated anymore.   Well he says as long as your water hasnt broken and the baby is moving then your fine and to only come to the hospital if my water breaks.... so wat am i suppose to do about my contractions if the get closer together,  he tells me as long as my child is moving then he is happy, excuse my launage but what type of stuff is that to say to a pregnant woman who is in pain.
